frameDefinitions: A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.
A Perpetrator (generally intentionally) commits a Crime, i.e. does something not permitted by the laws of society.
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
A Speaker declares that they will no longer be involved with the Content.
A Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a Message to some Addressee.
A Speaker addresses a Proposal made by an Interlocutor, either agreeing to it or rejecting it.
frameExamples: You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
They <t>perpetrated</t> a felony by substituting a lie for negotiations.
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
That will only be possible if and when the IRA <t>renounces</t> armed struggle.
She <t>affirmed</t> her loyalty to the cause.
They were <t>rebuffed</t> again in the larger city of Provo. CNI
listRoleDefinitions: The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The individual that commits a <fen>Crime</fen>.
An act, generally intentional, that has been formally forbidden by law.
When the <fen>Crime</fen> was committed.
The location where the <fen>Crime</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates their cessation of association with the <fen>Content</fen>.
The idea that the <fen>Speaker</fen> no longer associates with, whether it be an activity, a propostion, or a group.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement of renunciation.
The time when the statement is made.
The role specifies the place where the statement takes place.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'of' or about'.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
<fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates the reply or response.

This is the person who made the <fen>Proposal</fen> to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response. This frame element stands in for the <fen>Proposal</fen> and is only licensed when the <fen>Proposal</fen>  can be understood from the context.
The <fen>Proposal</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
listRoleExamples:
The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.
How can <fex>he</fex> commit treason against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?
How can he commit <fex>treason</fex> against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?
A murder perpetrated <fex>at 1:08AM this morning</fex> was not investigated until noon today.
We have jurisdiction over crimes committed <fex>in Woodside County</fex>.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
Bonnie Charlie then renounced <fex>his aspirations to the throne</fex>.
Castro renounced all involvement with the group <fex>over the radio</fex>.
No one believed <fex>Evelyn</fex>'s affirmation that she could speak to ghosts.
They refute the criticisms <fex>that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.
<fex>Iran</fex> on Saturday rejected Europe's proposal for ending the standoff over Tehran's nuclear program.

But senior SLN officials had rebuffed <fex>the man who is ever so willing to please
the guerrillas</fex>.
Dr. Carolyn Herrington has accepted <fex>our offer to become Dean of the College of Education</fex> .
This must make <fex>yesterday's</fex> Taliban rebuff all the more wounding.
Legislation that would have required smaller school districts to share administrators has been rebuffed repeatedly <fex>in the Oklahoma House of Representatives</fex>.
